subject: Assertions and Annotations
msgSnippet: I am not sure if anyone is interested in this and I have not read it.  But it may help with someone s learning.  And the book as a whole sounds interesting.

I am not sure if anyone is interested in this and I
have not read it.  But it may help with someone's
learning.  And the book as a whole sounds interesting.

http://www.theserverside.com/articles/article.tss?l=AgileJava_Chapter&News06_21_05-click


"In this lesson you will begin to build a testing
tool, similar to JUnit, based
upon Java�s annotation capabilities. The testing tool,
like JUnit, will need to
allow developers to specify assertions. Instead of
coding assertion methods,
you will learn to use Java�s built-in assertion
capability."

http://www.theserverside.com/articles/content/AgileJava_Chapter/AgileJava_Chapter.pdf

Cheers
Shane
